summary: The document outlines the establishment of a live address for Gladys G. Dambruwe in Cheverly, Maryland, on 17 May 1961, facilitated by Dr. Edward A. Gallogly and his household. It details the briefing provided to the household members on managing communications for Mrs. Dambruwe, under the pretense of her residing with them due to her son's imprisonment by a foreign government. Additionally, it mentions the coordination with local post offices for mail delivery and the dispatch of a telegram to Eustace Darenure in Cuba. The document also notes the daily contact with Dr. Gallogly, with no communications received for Mrs. Dambruwe as of 24 May 1961.
key_findings: Establishment of a live address for Gladys G. Dambruwe in Cheverly, Maryland.
Briefing of household members on handling communications for Mrs. Dambruwe.
Coordination with Cheverly and Hyattsville Post Offices for mail delivery.
Sending of a Western Union Telegram to Eustace Darenure in Cuba.
Daily contact maintained with Dr. Gallogly with no communication received for Mrs. Dambruwe as of 24 May 1961.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
